properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:34 P.M., Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is located 10 kilometres east of Orangeville, moving north at 25 km/h. Locations impacted include: Shelburne, Boyne Valley Provincial Park, Mono Cliffs Provincial Park, Mono Centre and Violet Hill. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-05-24T22:34:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-24T19:36:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3680573051.2020
Area: Shelburne - Mansfield - Northern Dufferin County, Orangeville - Grand Valley - Southern Dufferin County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:22 P.M. Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a couple of severe thunderstorms moving eastward through the regions capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. The thunderstorms will dissipate this evening. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:15 P.M. Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. There is also the risk of a tornado with this storm located 6 kilometres north of Borden tracking northeastward at 40 kilometres per hour. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Warmer temperatures expected mid week. A change in airmass is forecast for mid week with high temperatures expected to reach between 30 and 33 Celsius Tuesday, Wednesday and possibly Thursday. Corresponding humidex values will range from 35 to 38. Overnight lows are forecast to be between 18 and 22 Celsius. Cooler temperatures are forecast for the end of the week. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-25T11:02:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-24T19:03:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1515998527.2020

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Minimum temperatures: plus 1 to plus 5. Locations: most of Nova Scotia, including Cape Breton Island. Time span: Overnight and early Monday morning. Remarks: A combination of clear skies and light winds will give favourable conditions for patchy frost formation again tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-24T23:49:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-24T07:50:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2289807427.2020
Area: Kings County, Annapolis County, Lunenburg County, Queens County, Cumberland County - Minas Shore, Cumberland County North and Cobequid Pass, Colchester County - Cobequid Bay, Colchester County North, Hants County, Colchester County - Truro and south, Halifax Metro and Halifax County West, Halifax County - east of Porters Lake, Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke is causing poor air quality and reducing visibility. Smoke is expected or occurring. Location: West Porters Lake near exit 19 of Highway 107 An active forest fire near Highway 107 exit 19 is producing smoke and reduced air quality near the surface. Light westerly winds this morning will increase to southwest 20 km/h this afternoon and will likely cause the smoke plume to drift later in the day. Highway 107 remains closed between exits 18 and 20 and an Evacuation Comfort Centre has been established at the Lake Echo Community Centre for those in need of assistance. ### Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-05-24T22:59:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Nova Scotia Department of Health and Wellness, 2020-05-24T13:52:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0937549368.2020
Area: Halifax Metro and Halifax County West
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Nova Scotia Department of Health and Wellness

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Showers and a few thunderstorms will be locally heavy this afternoon. An area of showers with thunderstorms is expected to continue or develop near or south of Mount Forest this afternoon. These showers and storms will likely move east to northeastward through the afternoon. Heavy downpours giving rain amounts locally up to 25 millimetres are possible. Impacts may be reduced visibility while driving and ponding water on roads. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-25T03:16:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-24T16:36:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3454945776.2020
Area: Midland - Coldwater - Orr Lake, Orillia - Lagoon City - Washago, Barrie - Collingwood - Hillsdale, Owen Sound - Blue Mountains - Northern Grey County, Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County, Hanover - Dundalk - Southern Grey County, Wingham - Blyth - Northern Huron County, Listowel - Milverton - Northern Perth County, Goderich - Bluewater - Southern Huron County, Stratford - Mitchell - Southern Perth County, Mount Forest - Arthur - Northern Wellington County, Kitchener - Cambridge - Region of Waterloo, Innisfil - New Tecumseth - Angus, Shelburne - Mansfield - Northern Dufferin County, Orangeville - Grand Valley - Southern Dufferin County

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. A dense area of fog has developed over Kugluktuk. Fog will become less extensive this evening. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms capable of producing localized flash flooding. Severe thunderstorms are possible this afternoon or early this evening. The main threats are heavy downpours and there may be a few storms that produce hail up to 3 centimetres in diameter. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:20 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. At 4:18 P.M. Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A line of thunderstorms from Owen Sound to just west of Mount Forest will continue to intensify late this afternoon and move eastward. Heavy downpours are expected with these thunderstorms. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Tornado Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms which may produce tornadoes. Storm spotters and social media reports of rotating thunderstorm clouds in the area about 6 kilometres northwest of Angus. This storm will be monitored for possible tornado formation over the next hour. The storm is moving northeastward at 30 kilometres per hour. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.

Area: Barrie - Collingwood - Hillsdale

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy, accumulating snow continues in Coral Harbour. A further 2 to 4 cm is forecast to fall overnight and snow will gradually taper off Monday morning. ### Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
